title: FAO Animal Health Vaccination Campaign Against PPR in Syria

tasks.task: Participate in a vaccination campaign for PPR, a viral disease affecting sheep and goats.
subtasks: Travel to the outskirts of INAC in rural Damascus.
Coordinate with international donors (FAO, Russian project, DFID project, ORCHER) involved in the campaign.
Ensure the distribution of 8 million doses of temperature-sensitive vaccine within two to three weeks.
Prevent the spread of the disease by vaccinating 180,000 herders and small-scale livestock keepers.
Contribute to achieving zero hunger through protection of livestock assets.

tasks.task: Maintain the cold chain for the vaccine during transportation and distribution.
subtasks: Verify that the vaccine is stored at the required temperature range of 2 to 8 degrees Celsius.
Assess the cold store facilities used for vaccine storage.

tasks.task: Support the eradication of PPR as part of a global campaign.
subtasks: Collaborate with international efforts to eliminate the disease.
Recognize the disease's seriousness and the necessity of the vaccination campaign.

tasks.task: Engage with local village-level efforts in the campaign.
subtasks: Work closely with herders and small-scale livestock keepers in vaccination activities.
Educate community members about the importance of disease prevention and vaccination.
